intro: Hieracium poecilostictum, commonly known as the green-backed hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium poecilostictum is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils.
